localize.text: Hi, I’m Tiphereth!
Greetings, I’m Tiphereth too.
Ask if they’re twins.
Ask if they have just the same name.
Of course, can’t you see? We’re twins.
But if your question was whether we are biological twins, then no.
So trying to differentiate us is meaningless.
Of course, can’t you see? We’re twins.
But if your question was whether we are biological twins, then no.
So trying to differentiate us is meaningless.
I’m responsible for the Central Team. The team and office are huge, so I need at least two bodies to cover everything.
We are two.
Well, isn’t that fortunate.
Since you survived long enough, I don’t need to tell you about basic stuff like Abnormalities, right?
If you disappoint me, even your status as a manager will not save you.
But you’ll do fine.
A word of advice. I am not like the other upper Sephirahs you know. They're stupid.
Well, technically, we are not that different.
But what I want to say is, they’re only good at acting as if they’re busy when they’re not. I can’t believe we’re the same Sephirahs!
Anyway, the Central Department is where the real story begins. I don’t care if it disappoints or encourages you. I’m only focused on your performance.
I hope it will be an encouragement to you.
Hi, Tiphereth.
Hi, Netzach.
Since you're both Tiphereth, I'll just assume you both greeted me. Here's the plan for the cross-team training tomorrow. Please review it.
Review it? I'd probably have to rewrite it from the start!
Leave it there, Netzach. I will review it and let you know.
Tiphereth is too soft. You don’t need to be kind to an addict like Netzach, you might catch the "upper floor disease." And the plan came two days later than I asked!
But Netzach can work fine when he wants. You know that.
The result is not important. The point is, Angela is too easy on us. If I were her, I would have punished the addicted at once.
Well, that would please Yesod. Why don’t you two discuss about implementing a penalty system? I guess it will be productive...
Ah, be quiet! Just go back to the upper floor, where you belong.
I was about to. Bye, Tiphereth.
Yeah, bye Netzach.
The upper Sephirahs have it too easy. Not that I like all of the middle Sephirahs...
I like the middle Sephirahs, they’re all cheerful and make me laugh.
How many times have I told you not to laugh so easily? We have to be strict and stern! We’re the Central Team!
I know, Tiphereth. By the way, don’t we have something to discuss with the manager?
Oh, you’re still here? Well then, I have an assignment. Don’t think about slacking off.
The manager will do fine, as always.
And could fail, as always.
The employees have become more talkative these days.
They’re more motivated than usual. A lively atmosphere like this is rare; it's getting even me excited.
"Lively" isn't really the right word. More like, excited over a trivial matter. All because of a new manager. And that's nothing special to us.
Be more understanding, Tiphereth. It’s Lobotomy. News are rare other than someone’s death. The employees need something to talk about.
Well, if it makes them efficient even for a short time then yes, I can be understanding. But what I can’t understand is getting so noisy about it all.
But weren't you excited as well at first?
Well, yes! Because it was the first time!
We should be excited even if it’s not the first time.
Do you remember? We made a bet over whether the manager could save an employee that has 95% mental corruption.
Ah, of course. I bet on no, and you bet on yes.
Yes, but the employee died.
I was so happy with my victory, I insisted on continuing the bet. Even though the result was always same.
Right, but you stopped betting.
Well, you always lose... It's boring.
I didn’t bet without thinking it through. I always hoped for a change.
Sorry you're always disappointed.
Well, if we had infinite time, I guess a day would come when my hopes came true.
What do you think?
Maybe.
Absolutely not.
I think so, too.
Perhaps if we’ve met sooner...
Regardless of your opinion, I want to save them.
Maybe one day...
If you’re looking for Tiphereth, the meeting is still in progress.
I’m bad at conversation, I miss the managers who were talkative.
There’s something I wanted to ask.
Do you notice that someone’s memory and emotions are bleeding through us?
You must have seen us being angry, happy, sad, even if we’re machines.
And we even have our own weakness.
Why? What’s inside us?
If ‘something’ is inside us, why? Why make something imperfect, planting weakness?
I tried to find the answer,
but I gave up.
I think you may have the answer.
Somewhere in your memory,
there may be a reason why imperfection is required.
We’re machines, but not machines...
Not... machines...
Hey, are you having fun without me?
Tiphereth, anything seriously fun is not good.
It’s time for another replacement. The cycle is getting shorter and shorter.
But it can be reproduced anytime when needed, right?
Well, it’s still company property, so it shouldn’t be wasted.
Tiphereth, maybe we should explain it to the manager first.
But, why?
I told you Tiphereth, a human mind is fragile, it can’t take the existence of beings like us.
But it’s not that gross. It’s not as if an employee is decapitated or their internal organs are spilling out.
Humans fear the unknown. It doesn't have to be graphic.
Ugh... there are so many things to be mindful of...
Why can’t they replace managers with machines? It's not like they can't.
Tiphereth, there are things only humans can manage. The founder has a reason for assigning managers.
Well then... off we go to the storage. That’s one of the few locations where perception is weakened.
I know that place.
Tiphereth, what are you talking about? That’s where we always go.
I don’t mean that.
I remember what happened here.
You do? Great.
Thank you for helping me as always.
Manager, what do Sephirahs look like to you?
You must see them as humans, just like yourself.
Smiling, irritated, showing various expressions... more human than myself.
But, are you aware?
If there’s any AI sophisticated enough to be considered as a human,
it’s only me.
Didn’t I tell you from the beginning?
I am the one and only superb AI in here.
Seeing the truth, it’s not important around here.
Everything you see is distorted.
Everything here is constructed for you.
Can you understand that?
No need for another introduction, yes?
It’s Tiphereth. Whom you already met.
Ask if it’s Tiphereth.
Ask if it’s a machine.
What kind of stupid question is that? Then who do you think it is?
You look as if you are surprised, but I am sure you already know that we’re machines.
That expression never bores me.
I will tell you the truth. This is where it gets boring but your stupid expression saved the day.
You think I’m the only one? Every Sephirah you see are like me.
Thanks to that stupid AI Ethics Improvement Act.
And this is...
Where we were born, and where we shall return someday.
Perhaps, when everything is done, we will rest here, singing a song of our hometown.
I hope your next version will last longer.
Well then, Tiphereth, I will send the next one whenever he's ready.
Thank you, Angela.
So this is where everyone was at! Took me long enough to find you.
What’s happening, Malkuth?
Netzach asked me to fetch some documents from Tiphereth!
Oh, it’s not ready yet. Something urgent turned up. And tell Netzach that he should show up next time.
Well, Netzach seemed busy. I will tell him to visit you another time then!
Why are you upper guys all the same? Netzach is not busy at all! He just doesn’t want to move!
But I'm having fun!
Ah, you’re replacing Tiphereth now. The cycle is getting shorter... Does it worry you, Tiphereth?
Don't worry about me, just mind your notebook! It would be torn apart soon, by the look of it.
Oh, it is! Thanks for the concern. And it was a pleasure to meet you, manager!
Hi, I’m Tiphereth.
You can skip the introductions, Tiphereth. Now it’s time for you to examine the document Netzach gave us.
All right.
I thought Tiphereth had something to say to me.
What happens to Tiphereth now?
What would a broken machine have to say, anyways?
Tiphereth is overloaded.
It seemed to have some issues from the beginning,
but it got worse.
The machine's been replaced often, leaving part of the data and resetting it,
but the same error occurs at the same point.
What do you mean, what happens now?
Ah, are you talking about the replaced machine?
There could be new errors if it’s not completely destroyed.
That will put me in a very difficult position.
While ‘I’ am in charge of the Central Team, but you are me...
Told you, I need more than two of me around here.
I wanna go home...
You won't be able to go back home, just think of this place as your new home.
How can this place be home? Our home is different, and there’s no mom...
Well…. Why don’t you pretend Carmen is our new mom then?
No…. They aren’t same at all…. Let me go home…
Enoch, why do you keep participating in strange experiments?
We don’t have to.
Carmen also told me that we could take it easy here.
Of course it would be fun to spend time with you here without any worries.
I sometimes imagine a future like that.
It would be very happy.
But how then could we find the meaning of our lives?
Children abandoned in the outskirts are dying every day.
We were just the few lucky ones who could continue on living.
Living here in comfort is not why I exist.
It can’t be.
Your words are too hard for me. Why do you have so many thoughts in your mind?
Too much thinking may affect you negatively.
Lisa, I think I was always sad.
I never loved my own life for a second.
How nice would it be to live in a happy world next time?
Enoch….. Does it hurt?
No, it doesn’t hurt at all.
Don’t be sad. Something good will happen next time.
You're awake.
You are in Lobotomy, and I'm the one who woke you. All of you are now, ‘Tiphereth.'
You will support my amazing work here from now on.
Why do we have the same name?
Because there’s no point in distinguishing each one of you.
Hi, nice to meet you, Tiphereth.
I think I keep making mistakes, Tiphereth...
I’m helping you. Soon, you will be fine by yourself.
We made it so far! Without you, I'd have fallen behind the other Sephirahs!
We might be better partners than we thought!
Yeah, I think so, too.
Why do we ‘exist’ here?
Why do you think about it? We're part of the Central Department, with a bunch of assigned work here to do, so you should be focusing on the task at hand.
We are radically different from normal machines.
As I think about you and you think about me, if you worry, are in pain, and existing, then there must be a reason.
But if Angela finds out you're wondering about that she won’t be happy about it...
Angela, what will happen to Tiphereth?
Apart from the fact that his condition isn't normal, his excessive questions will affect the manager as well.
How unacceptable. Now I have to reset you and bring you back to normal status.
You'll be alright. You're just returning back to your first day.
But Angela, Tiphereth spent so much time with me...
You're really starting to act like a child now, Tiphereth. Say your goodbyes. You two will meet again soon.
Tiphereth, Tiphereth, Tiphereth..…
Why are you crying, Tiphereth?
Sorry, I couldn’t do anything...
Don’t be sad. Something good will happen next time.
Yeah...
You’re here.
Sometimes I spend time here.
It allows me think clearly.
Tiphereth always looked at the world with one step ahead of me.
In his own world that I will never know.
We were always together, but on second thought, we were never truly together.
Do you know that feeling of missing someone even though they are right next to you?
I'm don't anything about what the reason for existence that Tiphereth was talking about.
I just wanted to spend some quality time here together. That was all.
But this place won’t allow us to have that small luxury.
There are a number of Tiphereth's dead bodies here, can't you see?
I'm standing here stepping on their remains.
Trampling over the memories and all the time I spent with Tiphereth.
I am standing on the top of it now, but I still don’t get it. I still don’t understand your world, Tiphereth.
I sing a song from my home and mourn for you even though it will never reach you, Tiphereth.
Care to join me?
Tiphereth, what are you doing here?
I’m just thinking of old memories.
What memories?
The good old days when we were together.
You’re right, we had lots of fun together.
Come back to me as soon as you can, Tiphereth. I'll be reading the rest of the report.
Okay.
You can’t bring the old Tiphereth back by replacing the original machine and transmitting back its original memories!
Does it really matter? Tiphereth will continue to smile at you and will spend time with you, just like before.
Don’t say any careless words, Tiphereth. It’s meaningless here.
I don’t really like you.
The new manager always had an affect towards Tiphereth. This would eventually lead to a breakdown.
It will be the same, time after time.
We will discard Tiphereth again and again, and he will be changed from what he used to be.
I am scared of seeing Tiphereth burning out and being left empty from all those resets.
For now, he looks normal and talks with me about old memories that was forcefully transmitted, just like his old self.
But he’s getting worse and more unstable because they keep turning on the unstable machine.
You can make multiple copies of his body, but there can only be one soul.
Only one, but his soul was...
Could you do me a favor?
You used to do me other favors. Would you do me this one favor, just like old times?
Could you get rid of Tiphereth?
Angela used to say there was a reason for the two us being here. She used to say we are two but one,
but I can handle the Central Department all by myself. It was proven a long time ago.
Let Tiphereth rest in peace, as if he was alone from the beginning, before it gets any worse.
Why aren’t you saying anything?
In reality, Angela didn’t really care about us at all!
Whether there is one Tiphereth or two, whether another one just became a moving piece of metal scrap, or if thousands of discarded Tiphereth were melted for storage, she wouldn’t care!
But you’re different, at least you should be!
There were many abandoned children in the outskirts.
These children were the end results of the many conflicts of the Wings within the city.
Excluding disease and hunger, the scariest enemy to the children were the ones called, 'Cleaners.'
Cleaners usually ate children but sometimes "accompanied" them. Whatever the situation, it was a bad place for the children to be.
One fixer was exploring the outskirts and found the children.
We could guess why she bothered to report her findings to us.
We also knew that she spent days agonizing over whether to report this or not.
Carmen asked for her to bring the children.
Bringing the children into the city from the outskirts required a complicated procedure, but no one complained.
The two children didn’t look like siblings but they depended on one another much more than real siblings.
The girl was easily frightened and didn’t open up very much to us,
but the boy started to show interest in our experiment.
I saw it in his eyes.
He already experienced so much despair and misfortune, his eyes no longer looked of those of a child’s.
Allow me to participate in the experiment, he said.
Carmen spent a lot of time thinking about his earnest request,
and finally, we..
Approve the experiment.
Approve the experiment.
Approve the experiment.
Where did we want to go while holding a child's hand?
You should've been the one to die...
Yeah.. I... think... you should have died...
Lisa's hateful mumbling was possibly not sincere, but I knew.
Carmen’s answer was sincere.
From that day, Carmen quietly expanded the wound.
Enoch,
Have you ever heard of the Nest?
I heard a festival is held there every day.
I wanna dance, Enoch.
I wanna stomp my feet and let the happiness take over my body.
Lisa, if you take some time and look around here, it’s quite nice.
But there aren't many places where we can go. Carmen just keeps us locked up.
She’s a good person, so I hope you change your mind towards her.
I don’t want to get to know anyone else, all I want is to be with you.
I can’t promise to be with you forever.
I've many doubts that I've been mulling over for sometime, and I think I can find some answers here.
Some of my thoughts can be absurd, so the answers might not even exist at all,
or even if the answers exist, they might vanish soon.
But I think I shed my skin in the process of searching for the answers.
Maybe I can fly away, leaving my heavy body behind.
Sometimes, I have no idea what you are talking about.
I don’t know where you want to go, but please take me with you.
Oh, A is here, so I guess I gotta go now.
It's gonna get dark and cold soon. Let’s go inside.
Yeah, soon, cold days will come...
Even though I never thought of them as family or someone that I had to take care of,
I made it my job to bring the children back home, to ease Carmen's busy schedule.
I see.
The young children running towards me.
The children who survived the outskirts.
The children we saved.
I thought I could do it all by myself.
When Tiphereth came back, I wanted to show him how mature I became.
But there was no end to the disappointment, and Tiphereth didn’t get any better.
I couldn't stand the silence without getting an answer.
So I thought,
I'd rather,
I'd rather hide my disgust and guilt like it never existed.
But whenever I saw Tiphereth’s empty smile, my heart felt like it was tearing apart.
I knew that Tiphereth could never go back to how he used to be.
I knew that we could never return to the happy days we spent together.
But I was about to abandon Tiphereth because it was hard for me to deal...
I know Tiphereth was the one who suffered the most.
Tiphereth, are you done with all your busy work?
Too much time has passed. Let's go, the sun will set soon.
Hurry, Lisa.
Right, my name was Lisa once.
Tiphereth didn’t remember his name anymore, but he sometimes called me by my old name.
What did Tiphereth want from all of this, even after sacrificing himself?
What was he waiting for, even when he was being discarded?
Was it all worth it?
I don’t know.
I never expected anything.
But I'm counting on you now.
I want to believe that there was a reason for every sacrifice that was made, and to know that eventually, everything will be okay.
